result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

ADDRESS INFO for Michael Isaiah Wilson
Current: 3611 Patti Dr #1, Plover, WI 54467 United States  (Effective: 02-22-2022)
Prior: 3611 Patti Dr, Plover, WI 54467
Atty Russ Kort appointed
Pre-trial conference on March 7, 2022 at 10:00 am.

No contact with F.J.B. Jr. and F.J.B. Sr. 
Absolute sobriety.

02:50 PM Defendant Michael Isaiah Wilson in court. Prosecuting Assistant District Attorney (ADA) Andrew Mutchler appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

 Defendant received a copy of the criminal complaint.
Court informs defendant of the charges and maximum penalties.
Defendant waives reading of the complaint.

Court advises defendant of right to counsel/public defender representation.
Court directs the defendant to go to the public defenders office today to apply. 

NOT GUILTY plea(s) entered by the court on the defendant's behalf.

State recommends a $250 signature bond with conditions as stated.
Court questions Atty Mutchler. 
Defendant states he doesn't really know them. 
  Pre-trial conference scheduled for March 7, 2022 at 10:00 am.
